Is Cache expensive?

Cache, OK
State Oklahoma
Population 2,842

Compared to its surrounding areas, Cache is a bit more expensive, and it's substantially less expensive compared to the rest of the country. However compared to the city of Oklahoma City, it's a little less expensive.

Home prices

The median home in Cache is valued at $133,100. This is roughly $8,240 (6%) higher compared to other places in this area. In comparison to the country as a whole it is approximately $84,400 (38%) lower, and compared to the city of Oklahoma City is approximately $25,400 (16%) lower.

Rents

The median monthly rent in Cache is $725. In comparison to its nearby areas it is about $133 (15%) lower. In comparison to the country as a whole it is about $337 (31%) lower, and is approximately $146 (16%) lower in comparison to the city of Oklahoma City.

Nearby places

Medicine Park

Medicine Park is roughly 9 miles northeast from Cache. Its housing prices are a lot more expensive. Its median home price is $226,200, which comes out to $93,100 (41%) higher than Cache.

Lawton

Lawton is roughly 9 miles east from Cache. Its real estate prices are somewhat less expensive. Its median home value is $112,800, which works out to $20,300 (17%) lower than Cache.

Faxon

Faxon is approximately 12 miles south from Cache. Real estate prices there are fairly similar. The median home cost there is $131,300, which is $1,800 (1%) lower than Cache.

Chattanooga

Chattanooga is approximately 15 miles south of Cache. Its housing prices are substantially less expensive. Its median home value is $78,100, which comes out to $55,000 (70%) lower than Cache.

Geronimo

Geronimo is approximately 15 miles southeast from Cache. Real estate prices there are substantially less expensive. Its median home cost is $75,900, which works out to $57,200 (75%) lower than Cache.
